items.title: do not overwrite "captcha" files
items.body:
I came to a software (seafile) which require both 
https://pypi.org/project/django-simple-captcha/
 and
https://pypi.org/project/captcha/

packages. Apparently, django-simple-captcha installs files into the same location, a "captcha" folder overwriting other package's files.

Please install files into a unique folder name (django-simple-captcha).

items.title: Database Concerns
items.body:
A main issue I have is needing to store the captcha in the database each time a user comes to the page. The expiration date is too long to be stored in the database. It would be nice to set the expiration to a custom time to be able to automatically delete the data from settings.py. 

Another point of discussion is why even store the captcha in the database at all? Just seems like a bottleneck forcing websites with millions of page views a day to delete the data which can be quite costly to the database if there are a lot of records. I see that there is the pool option in the docs, but that makes it even easier for an attacker to guess the captcha if it doesn't keep changing. 

I see that there are pull requests that try to address this type of issue which has not been approved or worked on for years which is also concerning.

Storing in session might be best as opposed to the cache since cache can be a problem if there are hardware limitations. 

What would the cron job / postgres command / shell script alternative be to deleting the database items on a regular basis?

Otherwise maybe redesign the app to not need database storage and hidden input fields at all?

items.title: Black is ugly
items.body:
Please, do not use black formatting.

If you would like to make your code better, check https://wemake-python-stylegui.de/en/latest/

items.title: urls.py changes (url to path)?
items.body:
In the file urls.py I have an error:
 `url(r'^captcha/', include('captcha.urls')),`

this changed from url to path but I do not know how to make the change.

```
urlpatterns = [
    # New Django
    path('captcha/', views.____, name='_____'),
]
```

According to ```pip freeze``` I am using:
```
Django==2.2.3             
django-simple-captcha==0.5.12

```
DISREGARD:
just forgot to include:
```from django.urls import path, include```
and use
```
urlpatterns = [
    path('captcha/', include('captcha.urls')),
]
```

Any help will be appreciated, Thank You

items.title: Deprecation warning on Django 3.0 beta
items.body:
In Django 3.0, the function ugettext_lazy is deprecated, since it is a synonym with gettext_lazy in python3. You can refer to the release notes.

ugettext_lazy is used in captcha/fields.py and in captcha/tests/tests.py 

How would you proceed here? Since python 2 is EOL in about 2 months, do you think it would be a good idea to drop support for python 2 and to just replace the two instances of ugettext_lazy?

items.title: a question about installation of django-simple-captcha
items.body: I installed `captcha` with Python at first and didn't find wrong in my codes, but later when I generated `requirements. txt`, I found that `django-simple-captcha` was to be installed. After installation of `django-simple-captcha`, the contents of the `captcha/models.py` file disappeared.

items.title: render() got an unexpected keyword argument 'renderer'
items.body:
This is almost certainly because of this backwards-incompatible change in Django 2.1:

Support for Widget.render() methods without the renderer argument is removed.
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/52039654/django-typeerror-render-got-an-unexpected-keyword-argument-renderer

items.title: Customize CaptchaField Widget
items.body:
**Technical info:** Python 3.7 Django 2.1.4 **Context:** I tried a first approach by following the information of your documentation (and that of django of course). ```PY from captcha.fields import CaptchaField, CaptchaTextInput captcha = CaptchaField(widget=CaptchaTextInput(attrs={'class': 'form-control'})) ``` But looking in the rendering of the template, the value of the class is never applied. **Product HTML code:** ```HTML
``` So I tried a much more complete approach but as reported in your documentation it is only specified that CaptchaTextInput can be modified. Off it would be more interesting to allow the users to be able to modify the complete rendering of widget. A bit like this: File **app/widget.py**: ```PY from captcha.fields import CaptchaField class CustomCaptchaField(CaptchaField): template_name = "custom_path/captcha.html" ``` File **app/forms.py**: ```PY from app.widget import CustomCaptchaField class form(forms.Form): captcha = CustomCaptchaField(widget=CaptchaTextInput(attrs={'class': 'form-control'})) ``` File **custom_path/captcha.html**: ```HTML {% load i18n %} {% spaceless %}
{% if audio %} {% endif %}
{% include "django/forms/widgets/multiwidget.html" %}
{% endspaceless %} ``` Or if it's possible is need more documentation.

items.title: Audio captha does not speek '+'
items.body:
If CAPTCHA_CHALLENGE_FUNCT = 'captcha.helpers.math_challenge' is enabled in settings the '+' is not spoken. 
Users may not know what they are supposed to do.

items.title: Use standard rendering of widgets (vol. 2)
items.body:
By default, rendering should use standard templates for individual widgets. The additional attributes should be added through `Widget.attrs`.

Current status does not render correctly the HTML5 `required` attribute, and I expect similar problem applies to other `attrs` which may be passed to widget instances.

_Recreated due to accidental closure of #128 from #133._

items.title: Use standard rendering of widgets
items.body:
By default, rendering should use standard templates for individual widgets. The additional attributes should be added through `Widget.attrs`.

Current status does not render correctly the HTML5 `required` attribute, and I expect similar problem applies to other `attrs` which may be passed to widget instances.

items.title: Each solution has only one possible audio challenge, leading to possibility of a rainbow table type attack
items.body:
Hi,

For any given input text, Flite produces the same output audio every time (when used with the same settings in the same environment with the same version, at least - and all of these things would be true for a single server). This is unlike the image captchas, in which a single input text can randomly produce one of many, many challenge images. Because of this, it is possible for an attacker to generate all possible audio challenges and store them for lookup later. This is especially easy since the challenges are only 4 letters long.

To solve this problem, there should be many different possible audio challenges for each solution, so that it becomes infeasible for an attacker to generate all possible challenges in a reasonable amount of time.

To demonstrate this issue, I have written a [proof of concept](https://github.com/appleorange1/django-simple-captcha-cracker-poc) targeting your test application, which you can run to confirm the issue. I include more details, and some potential ideas for solutions, in the [README](https://github.com/appleorange1/django-simple-captcha-cracker-poc/blob/master/README.md) for that project.

Thanks,

appleorange1

items.title: captcha don't take effect in some cases
items.body:
HI, I found a bug with django-simple-captcha validator. And it is a common bug in some Python web framework. My login form: ``` from django.contrib.auth.forms import AuthenticationForm class MyAuthenticationForm(AuthenticationForm): captcha = CaptchaField(label='验证码', output_format='
%(text_field)s %(hidden_field)s
%(image)s
') class Meta: fields = [ 'email', 'password', 'captcha', ] ``` The AuthenticationForm.clean and the CaptchaField.clean, both of them will be executed at the same time. So when I render the MyAuthenticationForm.errors, the two errors will be shown tegether: ![sp161007_212305](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5711185/19191271/4c98a950-8cd4-11e6-85be-4550f2084115.png) So attackers would know his password attempt is successful or failed, although his captcha is error. Even I don't show the errors, if the password validator spend more time than the captcha validator, it may also allow an attacker to know if the password is correct.

items.title: The _imagingft C module is not installed
items.body:
Ubuntu 14.10 (OVH VPS).

/env/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/PIL/ImageFont.py in **getattr**, line 42

Pillow it's ok . (pip install pillow).

On MacOS is work fine but not with production Ubuntu server .

items.title: runnserver works fine but apache not
items.body:
apache2.2 + django1.8

After I add django-simple-captcha to this project

when I start server by:

python manage.py runserver 0.0.0.0:8000

everything goes fine

but when I start it by apache

It shows the error: "The _imagingft C module is not installed."

items.title: How to modify the path of generated image file?
items.body: Can I change it to something with "/static/" prefix?

items.title: Import Error. No module named Image
items.body:
I have found many questions on stackoverflow about this, but I guess I'm not smart enough to help myself with any of the solutions they provide. I have followed this documentation http://django-simple-captcha.readthedocs.org/en/latest/usage.html very precisely, but I must be just unlucky.

After adding this:

```
urlpatterns += patterns('',
    url(r'^captcha/', include('captcha.urls')),
)
```

to urls.py I'm getting this: ImportError at / No module named Image

I have no idea what's going on. The stack trace does not tell me much :)

Traceback:
File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/django/core/handlers/base.py" in get_response
1.                 resolver_match = resolver.resolve(request.path_info)
   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/django/core/urlresolvers.py" in resolve
2.             for pattern in self.url_patterns:
   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/django/core/urlresolvers.py" in url_patterns
3.         patterns = getattr(self.urlconf_module, "urlpatterns", self.urlconf_module)
   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/django/core/urlresolvers.py" in urlconf_module
4.             self._urlconf_module = import_module(self.urlconf_name)
   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/importlib/__init__.py" in import_module
5.     **import**(name)
   File "/home/wuser/mysite/mysite/urls.py" in <module>
6.    url(r'^captcha/', include('captcha.urls')),
   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/django/conf/urls/**init**.py" in include
7.         urlconf_module = import_module(urlconf_module)
   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/importlib/**init**.py" in import_module
8.     **import**(name)
   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/captcha/urls.py" in <module>
9. from captcha import views
   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/captcha/views.py" in <module>
10.     import Image

Exception Type: ImportError at /
Exception Value: No module named Image

items.title: Multiple different captcha widgets with different configurations
How hide captcha on re-entering form
items.body:
Hellow! 

Is it possible to hide captcha when re-entering form, if the first time the user enters the correct CAPTCHA?

items.title: Wrong translation for  German
items.body:
Hi guys,

in this file: https://github.com/mbi/django-simple-captcha/blob/master/captcha/locale/de/LC_MESSAGES/django.po are two spelling mistakes.

The correct German is: "Ungültiges CAPTCHA" and "Dieses Feld wird benötigt."

The third one "Spiel das CAPTCHA als Audiodatei ab." is not wrong but very colloquial. I would suggest "CAPTCHA als Audiodatei abspielen."

Best,
Ron

items.title: App name collision with `django-recaptcha`
items.body:
Is there a chance you could rename the app name from `captcha` to `simple_captcha`? At the moment you can't use both `django-simple-captcha` and `django-recaptcha`.

Considering the fact that your package is named `django-simple-capcha` (and not `django-captcha`) the change sounds quite logical.

items.title: Aurio problems
items.body:
hello, implementing de captch, it's ok but a want to implement the audio, have some problems, 
- Open the audio in the same page or download .wav
- Do not refresh the audio, when refresh the text

please can you help me tks..

items.title: Captcha label text
items.body:
How can I change standard 'Captcha' text in label?
Thanks

items.title: math_challenge
items.body:
Hello! Some times captcha show math expression, for example: 2 \* 2 =
But in real life, multiple operator is "x". Asterisk is more computer science symbol for multiple operation.
People who do not know can not understand this symbol

In this sample, \* replace to x:

``` python
def math_challenge():
    operators = ('+', 'x', '-',)
    operands = (random.randint(1, 10), random.randint(1, 10))
    operator = random.choice(operators)
    if operands[0] < operands[1] and '-' == operator:
        operands = (operands[1], operands[0])
    challenge = '%d%s%d' % (operands[0], operator, operands[1])
    return '%s=' % (challenge), text_type(eval(challenge.replace('x', '*')))
```

items.title: Please tag the versions/releases
items.body:
Hi,
I am trying to get django-simple-captcha in Alpine Linux, but I was asked to use a released versions or at least git tag for version, so it can be included in the next release (3.1) of Alpine.

Is it possible for you to tag your versions, pretty please?

Github has a nice page about how do this can be done https://help.github.com/articles/creating-releases/

Thanks

items.title: Invalid Markup: Attribute autocomplete not allowed on hidden inputs.
items.body:
Hello, the W3C validator shows this error when validating HTML5: "Attribute autocomplete not allowed on element input at this point.". The problem is on the hidden field. The autocomplete value can be used when type is text, search, url, tel, e-mail, password, datetime, date, month, week, time, datetime-local, number, range, or color (not hidden).

Thanks

items.title: Custom css class
items.body:
Hi,

Thanks for your package, Can I add to custom css class to field in the template??

items.title: Wrong autocomplete field attribute
items.body:
`autocomplete` must be apply to `type="text"`.

```
<input autocomplete="off" id="id_captcha_0" name="captcha_0" type="hidden" value="c337a1d545b5ed3d792f306d6630f0d10b46b48e">
<input id="id_captcha_1" name="captcha_1" type="text">
```

items.title: Autocomplete attribute
items.body:
Hello.

I think there could be done a very simple yet useful improvement.
CAPTCHA input field there should have autocomplete="off" attribute by default.
All modern browsers support it. Moreover, captcha is the canonical example of a form field where autocomplete shoud be turned off.

If it breaks some compatibility (I doubt it) it can be optional.

Thanks for the good app.

items.title: simplejson deprecated in recent Django
items.body:
With recent Django, we got this warning :
captcha/views.py:6: DeprecationWarning: django.utils.simplejson is deprecated; use json instead.

The easiest way to fix it is to replace as said. If you want to keep compatibility with older python/django, you can play with import and try/catch

items.title: Use multiple fonts
items.body:
Hi, I heard that using esp. different fonts within a captcha can drop down machine based OCR approaches [here for example](http://www.codinghorror.com/blog/2006/10/captcha-effectiveness.html).
So can you extend simple captcha to make use of a set of fonts, to make it robots a bit harder?

BTW. Thank you very much for your work, I really appreciate it, to avoid any 3rd party tracking widgets etc. :+1:

items.title: How to render on custom template
items.body: Hi, sorry, I'm actually quite new to this Django framework, so I'm having trouble in integrating the CaptchaField into my custom template. I would like to create my own img, hiddeninput and textbox in order to style them properly. The problem is, how do I get request a Captcha image source and key in order to pass them to the form itself? And, how do I actually create a working AJAX reset button? because I tried to use the code within the Docs, but it isn't working at all.

items.title: Requires Pillow even if I have PIL
items.body:
If I try to

```
pip install django-simple-captcha
```

it attempts to install Pillow. However, I don't want Pillow since I use PIL. Am I doing something wrong?

items.title: Captcha cut off
items.body:
Hi,

Rendered captcha's are often cut off at the bottom, making it hard to distinguish letters like Q from O, E from F and I from L.

![captcha](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/10639/848196/8724e6ca-f456-11e2-9d44-b321ad5b6c0e.png)

I'm using the following configuration with Python 2.7.3, django-simple-captcha 0.3.7 and pillow 2.1.0 on Ubuntu 12.04.

``` python
CAPTCHA_BACKGROUND_COLOR = '#000000'
CAPTCHA_FOREGROUND_COLOR = '#FFF200'
CAPTCHA_FONT_SIZE = 19
CAPTCHA_LENGTH = 4
CAPTCHA_NOISE_FUNCTIONS = ''
```

What could be causing this?

items.title: The form.is_valid() always return false when form is ModelForm
items.body:
```
If the form is forms.ModelForm, the function form.is_valid() always return false. 
```

Environment:
OS: Mac OS 10.8.4
Python: 2.7.2
Django: 1.3.1 and 1.5.1
simple-captcha: 0.3.8

items.title: Keep saying "invalid CAPTCHA".
items.body:
I followed the steps in document. But i always got the "invalid CAPTCHA" errors.

There is only one {{ form.captcha }} in my template, but once i load the page, two rows were inserted into the catpcha_captchastore table.

Windows 7
Python2.7
Django 1.3.0

items.title: Double calling BaseCaptchaTextInput.fetch_captcha_store()
items.body:
Double calling BaseCaptchaTextInput.fetch_captcha_store()

rev 3e73709af6de5bd6828ed7e9989187747af416b9

items.title: Double id "id_captcha_0" on multicaptcha page.
items.body:
I have an app with 2 forms powered django-simple-captcha field on one page. They are put on the page with {{ my_form_1.captcha }} and  {{ my_form_2.captcha }} tags (just examples). Hidden fields with names captcha_0 have same ids "id_captcha_0".

This situation makes invalid html and confusions during ajax refresh of this fields.

items.title: Support Python 3
items.body:
I use Python 3.3.0 + Django 1.5, and have some errors:
1. First
   File "/Users/vaxxxa/.virtualenvs/wonderay/lib/python3.3/site-packages/captcha/models.py", line 15
   MAX_RANDOM_KEY = 18446744073709551616L     # 2 << 63
                                        ^
   SyntaxError: invalid syntax
2. Second
   /Users/vaxxxa/.virtualenvs/wonderay/lib/python3.3/site-packages/captcha/views.py in <module>
   from cStringIO import StringIO
   ImportError at /
   No module named 'cStringIO'

Please, add python 3 support. Thanks.

items.title: Issue a new release on PyPi
items.body: The latest release on PyPi is 0.3.4 (2012-04-26). When will you release a new version to PyPi?

items.title: Using this captcha with non-django python application
items.body:
I like django-simple-captcha and want to use it with my project based on flask or other python framework.
Maybe, you can add wtforms CaptchaField. Or you have another solution...

items.title: Lower case i appearing as a lower case l
items.body: Not sure if it is just me but one of the images generated a straight vertical line - presumably an upper case I or a lower case l.  However, after several attempts to successfully submit the form, the last try a gave was using a lower case i, and it worked. So there is a possibility lower case i's are appearing as straight vertical lines without the dot.

items.title: tag missing height/width attribute
items.body: Would be great to have the captcha image have height and width attributes in their html tag. Makes the layout and surrounding elements more controllable when the spaceholder for the captcha is sized correctly

items.title: Testing Captcha enabled forms
items.body:
Hi, 
I may just not know how to do this right but I was wondering how I should approach writing test for forms that use the Captcha Field.  I've resorted to just disabling it while I'm testing.

Thanks.

items.title: USE_TZ = True
items.body: Django by default sets this option to false but it should be set to True for this simple-captcha to work correctly.

items.title: RuntimeWarning: DateTimeField received a naive datetime (Django 1.4+)
items.body:
I'm working on trunk of Django and got this warning when using django-simple-captcha:

RuntimeWarning: DateTimeField received a naive datetime
To make the timestamp timezone aware modify the models.py:
1. Add import: from django.utils.timezone import utc
2. Replace line 29 with:

self.expiration = datetime.datetime.utcnow().replace(tzinfo = utc) + datetime.timedelta(minutes = int(captcha_settings.CAPTCHA_TIMEOUT))

See the docs:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/dev/topics/i18n/timezones/#migration-guide

items.title: Can I validate captcha individually in a ajax view?
items.body: rather than validate it as a part of a django form?
